sentences.english: ...a calf injury.
sentences.chinese: …一处小腿的伤。

detailed_translations.chinese: [解剖] 腓肠，小腿；小牛；小牛皮；(鲸等大哺乳动物的)幼崽
detailed_translations.english: the part of the back of your leg between your knee and your  ankle

name: mammal
trans: n. [脊椎] 哺乳动物

sentences.english: A whale is a kind of mammal.
sentences.chinese: 鲸是一种哺乳动物。

sentences.english: The whale is a mammal.
sentences.chinese: 鲸鱼是哺乳动物。

sentences.english: The problem with that theory is that no other mammal has resorted to this method of cooling down.
sentences.chinese: 这一理论的问题在于，没有其他的哺乳动物采取了这种降低体温的方式。

detailed_translations.english: a type of animal that drinks milk from its mother’s body when it is young. Humans, dogs, and whales are mammals.

name: surface
trans: n. 表面；表层；外观 adj. 表面的，肤浅的 vi. 浮出水面 vt. 使浮出水面；使成平面 n. (Surface)人名；(英)瑟菲斯

sentences.english: Nearly 10% of the Earth’s surface is covered by ice.
sentences.chinese: 地球表面将近 10% 被冰层覆盖。

sentences.english: Gas bubbles in any liquid tend to rise to the surface .
sentences.chinese: 在任何液体中气泡往往都会浮到表面。

detailed_translations.english: the top layer of an area of water or land
relating to the part of the army, navy etc that travels by land or on the sea, rather than by air or under the sea
if someone or something surfaces, they suddenly appear somewhere, especially after being gone or hidden for a long time

name: bounce
trans: v. 弹起；反弹；蹦跳；把小孩放在膝上颠着玩；上下晃动；颠簸行进；蹦蹦跳跳地走；退回（支票）；试探地透露（主意）；退回（电子邮件）；解雇；逐出；威吓（某人）做；征求别人的看法；撞击 n. 弹跳；弹力；活力；（突然的）上升；十足的自信；（头发的）弹性；碰撞

sentences.english: Stop bouncing up and down on the sofa.
sentences.chinese: 别在沙发上蹦来蹦去了。

detailed_translations.english: if a ball or other object bounces, or you bounce it, it immediately moves up or away from a surface after hitting it
the action of moving up and down on a surface

name: brainstorm
trans: n. 集思广益；头脑风暴；灵机一动 vt. 集体讨论；集思广益以寻找 vi. 集体讨论；动脑筋；出主意

sentences.english: While some of the greatest ideas and solutions come up in brainstorm meetings, we also lose most of our time in discussion without action.
sentences.chinese: 当在头脑风暴的会议上有一些顶级的主意或者解决方法提出时，我们也浪费了很多时间在没有行动的讨论上。

detailed_translations.chinese: 集思广益；头脑风暴；灵机一动
集体讨论；集思广益以寻找

name: idea
trans: n. 想法；主意；概念

sentences.english: You should talk to Ken – he's always full of good ideas.
sentences.chinese: 你应该和肯谈谈，他总是满脑子好主意。

sentences.english: I knew it was a bad idea to leave him on his own.
sentences.chinese: 我知道把他独自留下不是个好主意。

sentences.english: It was my wife’s idea to move house.
sentences.chinese: 要搬家是我妻子的主意。

sentences.english: He has some very strange ideas about education.
sentences.chinese: 他对教育有些非常奇怪的看法。

detailed_translations.english: a plan or suggestion for a possible course of action, especially one that you think of suddenly

name: trail
trans: n. 足迹；（跟踪某人的）踪迹；（尤指细长）一缕；（人或动物）排成的长队；（荒野）小路；特定路线；滑雪坡；（炮架的）架尾；（电影等的）预告片 v. 拖，拉；（尤指植物）蔓延；（尤指根据痕迹等）追踪；（在游戏、比赛中）落后；拖沓行走；（声音、喇叭）减弱；预告（影片、节目等）；喷注（泥釉） n. (Trail) （美）特雷尔（人名）

sentences.english: The trail led over Boulder Pass before descending to a lake.
sentences.chinese: 小路越过博尔德山口，然后向下通往湖边。

sentences.english: The bus left a trail of black smoke behind it.
sentences.chinese: 公共汽车开过，留下一股黑烟。

sentences.english: Police trailed the gang for several days.
sentences.chinese: 警察跟踪了那个团伙好几天。

detailed_translations.english: a rough path across countryside or through a forest
to follow someone by looking for signs that they have gone in a particular direction

name: trampoline
trans: n. 蹦床；弹簧垫

name: yard sale
trans: 庭院旧货出售

detailed_translations.english: a sale of used clothes and things from someone’s house which takes place in their yard

name: messy
trans: adj. 凌乱的；使不整洁的；（情况）棘手的 n. (Messy) （法）墨史丽（人名）

sentences.english: a messy room
sentences.chinese: 凌乱的房间

sentences.english: Sorry the place is so messy, I haven’t had time to clear up.
sentences.chinese: 对不起，这地方又脏又乱，我一直没时间打扫。

detailed_translations.chinese: 凌乱的，散乱的；肮脏的，污秽的；麻烦的
detailed_translations.english: dirty or untidy

name: neat
trans: adj. 灵巧的；整洁的；优雅的；齐整的；未搀水的；平滑的

sentences.english: neat handwriting
sentences.chinese: 工整的笔迹

sentences.english: His clothes were always neat and clean.
sentences.chinese: 他的衣服总是很整洁。

sentences.english: Everything in the house was neat and tidy.
sentences.chinese: 房子里的每样物品都干净整齐。

sentences.english: She arranged the books in a nice neat pile.
sentences.chinese: 她把书摞成整齐的一堆。

detailed_translations.english: tidy and carefully arranged

name: organize
trans: vt. 组织；使有系统化；给予生机；组织成立工会等 vi. 组织起来；成立组织

sentences.english: The course was organized by a training company.
sentences.chinese: 这一课程是由一家培训公司组织的。

sentences.english: Students need to learn how to organize their work.
sentences.chinese: 学生要学会如何安排好自己的学习。

sentences.english: We are learning about how genes are organized.
sentences.chinese: 我们在了解基因是如何排列的。

detailed_translations.english: to make the necessary arrangements so that an activity can happen effectively

name: promise
trans: n. 许诺，允诺；希望 vt. 允诺，许诺；给人以…的指望或希望 vi. 许诺；有指望，有前途

sentences.english: If you make a promise, you should keep it.
sentences.chinese: 如果你许下一个诺言，你就应该遵守它。

sentences.english: Last night the headmaster promised a full investigation.
sentences.chinese: 校长昨晚允诺进行全面调查。

detailed_translations.english: a statement that you will definitely do or provide something or that something will definitely happen
to tell someone that you will definitely do or provide something or that something will happen

name: rule
trans: n. 规则；建议；统治；习惯；定律；法治；尺子；破折号 v. 统治，管理；支配；规定；裁决；用尺画；（非正式）极好；（行星）对……有影响；（价格）普遍处于某一水平 n. (Rule) （西）鲁莱（人名）

sentences.english: The judge ruled that she should have custody of the children.
sentences.chinese: 法官判定孩子的监护权归她。

detailed_translations.english: to make an official decision about something, especially a legal problem

name: slob
trans: n. 懒汉；笨蛋；粗俗汉 n. (Slob)人名；(英)斯洛布

name: café
trans: n. 咖啡馆；小餐馆

sentences.english: ...an Italian street café.
sentences.chinese: …一家意大利街边小餐馆。

detailed_translations.english: a small restaurant where you can buy drinks and simple meals

name: milkweed
trans: n. 乳草属植物；马利筋属植物；野参类

sentences.english: This is because their staple food, milkweed, is being used more and more as a garden ornament.
sentences.chinese: 这是因为它们的主要食物乳草被越来越多的用于园林装饰。

detailed_translations.english: any plant of the mostly North American genus Asclepias, having milky sap and pointed pods that split open to release tufted seeds: family Asclepiadaceae

name: monarch
trans: n. 君主，帝王；最高统治者

sentences.english: Britain's head of state is a constitutional monarch.
sentences.chinese: 英国的国家元首是君主立宪的国王或女王。

detailed_translations.english: a king or queen

name: nectar
trans: n. [植] 花蜜；甘露；神酒；任何美味的饮料 n. (Nectar)人名；(罗)内克塔尔

sentences.english: Bees gather nectar from flowers.
sentences.chinese: 蜜蜂从花朵上采集花蜜。

sentences.english: Upon returning to the hive, they deposit the nectar into pockets, called honeycombs, in the hive’s walls. It is from here that we get honey.
sentences.chinese: 一返回蜂房，它们便将花蜜储存在被称作“六角形蜂窝”的蜂房壁上的小巢中，我们就是从那里采集蜂蜜的。

detailed_translations.english: the sweet liquid that bees collect from flowers

name: shelter
trans: n. 庇护；避难所；遮盖物 vt. 保护；使掩蔽 vi. 躲避，避难 n. (Shelter)人名；(英)谢尔特

sentences.english: The men took shelter in a bombed-out farmhouse.
sentences.chinese: 那些男人躲在一间被炸毁的农舍里。

sentences.english: All around me, people were running for shelter .
sentences.chinese: 我周围的人都在奔跑着寻找地方躲避。

sentences.english: ...a wooden house, sheltered by a low pointed roof.
sentences.chinese: …一座由低矮的尖屋顶遮蔽的木房子。

detailed_translations.english: protection from danger or from wind, rain, hot sun etc
If a place or thing is sheltered by something, it is protected by that thing from wind and rain

name: sprout
trans: vi. 发芽；长芽 vt. 使发芽；使萌芽 n. 芽；萌芽；苗芽 n. (Sprout)人名；(英)斯普劳特

sentences.english: Move the pots outside when the seeds begin to sprout.
sentences.chinese: 种子开始发芽时把盆搬到外面去。

sentences.english: Trees were starting to sprout new leaves.
sentences.chinese: 树上开始抽出新叶。

detailed_translations.english: if vegetables, seeds, or plants sprout, they start to grow, producing  shoots  ,  buds  , or leaves
a small green vegetable like a very small  cabbage

name: butterfly
trans: n. 蝴蝶；蝶泳；举止轻浮的人；追求享乐的人

sentences.english: Butterflies and moths are attracted to the wild flowers.
sentences.chinese: 蝴蝶和飞蛾为野花所吸引。

detailed_translations.english: a type of insect that has large wings, often with beautiful colours

name: caterpillar
trans: n. [无脊椎] 毛虫；履带车 adj. 有履带装置的

sentences.english: A caterpillar transforms into a butterfly.
sentences.chinese: 毛虫变成了蝴蝶。

sentences.english: The caterpillar might well give you nightmares though!
sentences.chinese: 但是，它的毛虫却可能引起你噩梦！

sentences.english: The caterpillars grow.This caterpillar is big and fat.
sentences.chinese: 这毛虫渐渐成长.这个毛虫是大的和肥的。

detailed_translations.english: a small creature like a  worm  with many legs that eats leaves and that develops into a  butterfly  or other flying insect

name: mate
trans: n. 助手，大副；配偶；同事；配对物 vt. 使配对；使一致；结伴 vi. 交配；成配偶；紧密配合 n. (Mate)人名；(日)蛏(姓)；(西、意、塞)马特；(波黑)马特；(罗、俄)马泰

sentences.english: He has found his ideal mate.
sentences.chinese: 他已经找到了理想的配偶。

detailed_translations.chinese: 助手，大副；配偶；同事；配对物
detailed_translations.english: someone you work with, do an activity with, or share something with
if animals mate, they have sex to produce babies

name: pupa
trans: n. [昆] 蛹 n. (Pupa)人名；(意)普帕

name: stage
trans: n. 阶段；舞台；戏剧；驿站 vt. 举行；上演；筹划 vi. 举行；适于上演；乘驿车旅行 n. (Stage)人名；(英)斯特奇

sentences.english: We’re getting to the stage where we hardly ever go out together.
sentences.chinese: 我们快要到几乎不一起外出的地步了。

sentences.english: She is on stage for most of the play.
sentences.chinese: 这出戏的大部分时间里她都在台上

detailed_translations.english: a particular time or state that something reaches as it grows or develops

name: dessert
trans: n. 餐后甜点；甜点心 n. (Dessert)人名；(法)德塞尔

sentences.english: She had homemade ice cream for dessert.
sentences.chinese: 她吃了些自制冰淇淋当餐后甜点。

detailed_translations.english: sweet food served after the main part of a meal

name: holiday
trans: n. 假日；节日；休息日 vi. 外出度假 n. (Holiday)人名；(英)霍利迪

sentences.english: The school holidays start tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 学校假期从明天开始。

sentences.english: a national holiday
sentences.chinese: 全国假日

detailed_translations.english: a time of rest from work, school etc

name: neighbor
trans: n. 邻居 adj. 邻近的 vi. 友好；毗邻而居 vt. 邻接 n. (Neighbor)人名；(英)内伯

sentences.english: I parked my baby at the neighbor's house.
sentences.chinese: 我把小孩寄放在邻居家里。

sentences.english: It means you love Him with all your heart, and you love your neighbor as yourself.
sentences.chinese: 它意味着你全心全意的爱上帝并且像爱自己那样爱邻居。

sentences.english: See, if you break any one of those commandments, you do not love your neighbor as yourself.
sentences.chinese: 看，如果你违反了其中任何一条戒律，你就没能像爱自己那样爱邻居。

name: tamale
trans: n. （墨西哥）玉米粉蒸肉

name: Thanksgiving
trans: n. 感恩

sentences.english: He said sometimes they would invite some friends to share the happiness of Thanksgiving Day.
sentences.chinese: 他说有时候他们也会邀请一些朋友来一起分享感恩节快乐。

sentences.english: I hear about these people every Thanksgiving, then never think about them again for the next 364 days.
sentences.chinese: 我在每个感恩节都听说过这群人，而后在接下来的364天，就再也没有想起过他们。

sentences.english: It compares with "Cyber Monday" in the US - the day after Thanksgiving marketed as a big online shopping day.
sentences.chinese: 它与“网络星期一”在美国，感恩节后的第一天销售作为一个大型网上购物一天。

detailed_translations.english: a public holiday in the US and in Canada when families have a large meal together to celebrate and be thankful for food, health, families etc

name: fit
trans: vt. 安装；使……适应；使……合身；与……相符 vi. 符合，配合；适合；合身 adj. 健康的；合适的；恰当的；准备好的 n. 合身；发作；痉挛 n. (Fit)人名；(捷、罗)菲特

sentences.english: The sash, kimono, and other garments were made to fit a child.
sentences.chinese: 这些腰带、和服和其他衣服都做得适合孩子穿。

detailed_translations.english: to put a piece of equipment into a place, or a new part onto a machine, so that it is ready to be used
if something fits another thing, it is similar to it or suitable for it

name: grave
trans: n. 墓穴，坟墓；死亡；沉音符；（废旧机器等的）堆积处 adj. 重大的；严肃的；黯淡的；有沉音符的；（乐）缓慢的 v. 雕刻；铭记；拷铲油漆（船底） adv. （乐）缓慢地，庄严地 n. (Grave) （德、英）格拉维（人名）

sentences.english: Matthew’s life is in grave danger .
sentences.chinese: 马修的生命危在旦夕。

sentences.english: The report expressed grave concern over the technicians’ lack of training.
sentences.chinese: 报告中对技术人员缺乏培训深表忧虑。

sentences.english: I have grave doubts about his ability.
sentences.chinese: 我十分怀疑他的能力。

sentences.english: The situation is becoming very grave.
sentences.chinese: 形势变得非常严峻。

detailed_translations.english: grave problems, situations, or worries are very great or bad
the place in the ground where a dead body is buried
to cut, carve, sculpt, or engrave

name: marry
trans: vt. 嫁；娶；与……结婚 vi. 结婚 n. (Marry)人名；(阿拉伯)马雷；(法)马里

sentences.english: He married Bea in 1925.
sentences.chinese: 他在1925年娶了贝亚。

sentences.english: I’m going to ask her to marry me on St Valentine’s Day.
sentences.chinese: 我打算在情人节向她求婚。

sentences.english: She married young (= at a young age ) .
sentences.chinese: 她结婚早。

sentences.english: People in higher social classes are more likely to marry late (= when they are older than is usual ) .
sentences.chinese: 社会阶层较高的人士倾向于晚婚。

sentences.english: Sophia had, in a sense, married beneath her (= married someone of a lower social class than her ) .
sentences.chinese: 索菲娅在某种意义上是下嫁了。

detailed_translations.english: if you marry someone, you become their husband or wife
if you marry someone, you become their husband or wife

name: midnight
trans: n. 午夜，半夜12点钟 adj. 半夜的；漆黑的

sentences.english: You can’t phone her now – it’s gone midnight (= after midnight ) !
sentences.chinese: 你现在不能打电话给她，都过午夜了！

sentences.english: By the time he arrived, it was well past midnight (= after midnight ) .
sentences.chinese: 他到的时候早已经是后半夜了。

sentences.english: He’s gone for a midnight swim.
sentences.chinese: 他深更半夜去游泳了。

detailed_translations.english: 12 o’clock at night

name: twig
trans: n. 小枝，嫩枝，末梢；血管小支 v. （非正式）顿悟；（古）察觉

sentences.english: There is the bird, sitting on a twig halfway up the tree.
sentences.chinese: 鸟儿在那里，栖息在树中段的一根细枝上。

detailed_translations.english: to understand (something)
a small very thin stem of wood that grows from a branch on a tree

name: wish
trans: v. 希望，但愿；盼望，想要；祝，祝愿；祈愿，许愿；（印度英语）问候；要求（某人）做某事 n. 希望，愿望；祈求，心愿；祝愿，祝福；想要的东西，希望的事；请求，要求 n. (Wish) （美）威什（人名）

sentences.english: Close your eyes and make a wish.
sentences.chinese: 闭上眼睛许个愿。

detailed_translations.english: a desire to do something, to have something, or to have something happen
to want something to be true although you know it is either impossible or unlikely

name: chick
trans: n. 小鸡；小鸟；少妇 adj. 胆小的；懦弱的 n. (Chick)人名；(英)奇克

sentences.english: a mother hen with her chicks
sentences.chinese: 和小鸡在一起的鸡妈妈

detailed_translations.english: a baby bird

name: falcon
trans: n. [鸟] 猎鹰；[鸟] 隼 n. (Falcon)人名；(法、意、西、葡、罗、瑞典)法尔孔；(英)福尔肯

sentences.english: Animals representing mythical powers and military might surrounded him—pumas, a wolf, eagles, a falcon, an owl, and rattlesnakes—some buried alive in cages.
sentences.chinese: 一些动物作为神和军事的力量的象征置放在他的周围——美洲狮、狼、鹰、隼、猫头鹰、响尾蛇——装在笼子里一起活埋。

detailed_translations.english: a bird that kills and eats other animals and can be trained to hunt

name: hungry
trans: adj. 饥饿的；渴望的；荒年的；不毛的

sentences.english: I was cold, tired, and hungry.
sentences.chinese: 我又冷，又累，又饿。

sentences.english: If you get hungry, there’s some cold chicken in the fridge.
sentences.chinese: 你要是饿了，冰箱里有些冷鸡肉。

sentences.english: Do you still feel hungry?
sentences.chinese: 你还觉得饿吗？

sentences.english: She is hungry for success.
sentences.chinese: 她渴望成功。

detailed_translations.english: wanting to eat something

name: prey
trans: n. 猎物；受害者，牺牲品；（情绪易受伤的）脆弱的人；掠夺品 v. 捕食；伤害；折磨，困扰 n. (Prey) （美、德、爱）普赖（人名）

sentences.english: a tiger stalking its prey
sentences.chinese: 潜行跟踪猎物的老虎

healthy

a wound caused by rubbing that slightly breaks the surface of your skin

sentences.chinese: 贝琳达热情地招呼她。
